item.title: Chemonics International Data Breach Impacts 260,000 Individuals
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Development firm Chemonics International has disclosed a year-old data breach impacting over 260,000 people.

The post Chemonics International Data Breach Impacts 260,000 Individuals appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Industry Moves for the week of December 2, 2024 - SecurityWeek
item.description: Explore industry moves and significant changes in the industry for the week of December 2, 2024. Stay updated with the latest industry trends and shifts.

item.title: System Two Security Emerges From Stealth With Detection Engineering Solution
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
System Two Security has emerged from stealth mode with a threat detection engineering solution and $7 million in seed funding.

The post System Two Security Emerges From Stealth With Detection Engineering Solution appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: White House Says at Least 8 US Telecom Firms, Dozens of Nations Impacted by China Hacking Campaign
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
A top White House official said at least eight U.S. telecom firms and dozens of nations have been impacted by a Chinese hacking campaign.

The post White House Says at Least 8 US Telecom Firms, Dozens of Nations Impacted by China Hacking Campaign appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: BT Investigating Hack After Ransomware Group Claims Theft of Sensitive Data
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
UK telecoms company BT has launched an investigation after the Black Basta ransomware group claimed the theft of 500 Gb of data.

The post BT Investigating Hack After Ransomware Group Claims Theft of Sensitive Data appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Veeam Warns of Critical Vulnerability in Service Provider Console
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Veeam releases patches for two vulnerabilities in Service Provider Console, including a critical-severity remote code execution bug.

The post Veeam Warns of Critical Vulnerability in Service Provider Console appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Spy v Spy: Russian APT Turla Caught Stealing From Pakistani APT
item.dc:creator: Ryan Naraine
item.description:
Russia's Turla hackers hijacked 33 command servers operated by Pakistani hackers who had themselves breached Afghanistan and Indian targets.

The post Spy v Spy: Russian APT Turla Caught Stealing From Pakistani APT appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Largest German Crime Marketplace Taken Down, Administrator Arrested
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Crimenetwork, the largest German-speaking online crime marketplace, has been shut down and one of its admins has been arrested.

The post Largest German Crime Marketplace Taken Down, Administrator Arrested appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Tuskira Scores $28.5M for AI-Powered Security Mesh
item.dc:creator: Ryan Naraine
item.description:
Tuskira is working on an AI-powered security mesh promising to integrate fragmented security tools and mitigate risk exposure in real time.

The post Tuskira Scores $28.5M for AI-Powered Security Mesh appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: CISA Warns of Zyxel Firewall Vulnerability Exploited in Attacks
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
A second vulnerability in Zyxel firewalls has been exploited in Helldown ransomware attacks over the past weeks.

The post CISA Warns of Zyxel Firewall Vulnerability Exploited in Attacks appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Government Guidance on Chinese Telco Hacking Highlights Threat to Cisco Devices
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Government agencies issue guidance on Chinese telecoms hacking as US officials say threat actors may have yet to be expelled.Â 

The post Government Guidance on Chinese Telco Hacking Highlights Threat to Cisco Devices appeared first on SecurityWeek.
